statement: Your friends' opinion of your partner should be a dealbreaker

agreeReasons: Friends see red flags you miss
They know you better than anyone
disagreeReasons: Friends can be jealous or wrong
You're the one living it daily

statement: You shouldn't promise to stay with someone through severe disability
originalQuestion: If I were severely injured after an accident and could not care for myself, would you stay and look after me?
agreeReasons: No one knows until they're there
Being honest is kinder than false promises
disagreeReasons: Love shows up in the hardest moments

statement: Money makes relationships more complicated
originalQuestion: Does money make a relationship more complicated?
agreeReasons: Power dynamics shift with wealth gaps
Debt and spending create constant friction
Class backgrounds clash in subtle ways
disagreeReasons: Good communication handles any financial gap
Shared values matter more than income
Complications come from people not money
Wealth can actually reduce relationship stress

statement: The higher earner should pay proportionally more in a relationship
originalQuestion: How should you approach expenditure if one person in the relationship earnssignificantly more than the other?
agreeReasons: Keeps lifestyle balanced for both people
disagreeReasons: Both adults should cover their share

statement: Waning attraction means you should end the relationship
originalQuestion: If you feel like your love for your partner wanes over time, should you end the relationship or not?
agreeReasons: Passion is essential to romantic love
The spark matters for long-term happiness
disagreeReasons: All long relationships ebb and flow
Attraction can be rekindled with effort
Commitment means working through dry spells
Friendship foundation matters more over time

statement: Watching ahead on a show you're watching together is a betrayal
originalQuestion: What would you do if you found out that alone I’d watched the season finale of a Netflix series we’d been watching together?
agreeReasons: The anticipation together is the point
disagreeReasons: The other person can still enjoy it
Life's too short for these rules
Not everything needs to be shared

statement: You should try to pull your partner out of conspiracy theory rabbit holes
originalQuestion: If your partner fell down a rabbit hole related to a conspiracy theory, how would you react?
agreeReasons: Love means protecting from harmful beliefs
It affects your shared life together
disagreeReasons: Pushing back makes them dig deeper
Adults get to believe what they want
Your job isn't to fix their thinking
Some things aren't worth the fight

statement: Forgetting your partner's birthday is unforgivable
originalQuestion: How would you react if your partner forgot your birthday?
disagreeReasons: People have different memory for dates

statement: Wanting to delay kids without a 'good reason' is perfectly valid
originalQuestion: Would you be ok with us not trying for children right now? (Without a concrete reason)
agreeReasons: Gut feeling matters with huge decisions
Not feeling ready is reason enough
disagreeReasons: Major life decisions need clear thinking
Sometimes you need a push forward

statement: Open relationships are just slow-motion breakups
originalQuestion: Would you ever consider having a casual open relationship where both of you could see other people?
agreeReasons: One person always wants it more

statement: Opposite political views are a relationship dealbreaker
originalQuestion: Could you be in a relationship with someone who had diametrically opposed political views to yours?
agreeReasons: Politics reflect core values and morality
Kids would be caught in ideological war
You can't respect someone whose views disgust you

statement: Complete honesty in relationships is overrated
originalQuestion: Are you always completely honest with me in our relationship?
agreeReasons: Some truths only cause unnecessary pain
Privacy and secrets aren't the same
Brutal honesty is often just cruelty
disagreeReasons: You can be honest and kind

statement: Looking up your ex on social media means you're not over them
originalQuestion: Do you ever try to search for your ex on social media?
agreeReasons: If you were over it you wouldn't care
It's emotional cheating on current relationship
Keeps you stuck in the past
disagreeReasons: Human curiosity doesn't mean anything deep
You can be fully moved on and still curious

statement: Polyamory is just as valid as monogamy—loving multiple people isn't cheating
originalQuestion: What’s your opinion on people who fall in love with more than one person at once?
agreeReasons: Honest multiple relationships beat secret affairs
disagreeReasons: Most people aren't emotionally equipped for it

statement: If you could start any billion-dollar company, you have a moral duty to make it solve a major world problem
originalQuestion: If you could own a billion-dollar company that doesn’t yet exist, what would the company do?
agreeReasons: That level of resources comes with responsibility
Market rewards solving real problems anyway
Legacy matters more than another widget
Climate and poverty crises need urgent action
disagreeReasons: Entrepreneurs deserve to pursue their passion
Markets decide what's valuable, not moral duty
Innovation often comes from unexpected places
Entertainment and joy are valuable too

statement: If we could stop aging, we absolutely should—death is humanity's biggest problem
originalQuestion: If we discovered the secret to stopping the ageing process, would you want to use it or not?
agreeReasons: Death ends everything we love and value
More time means more growth and wisdom
We fight disease, why not aging?
disagreeReasons: Mortality gives life meaning and urgency

statement: Once AI becomes truly sentient, denying it equal rights would be no different than slavery
originalQuestion: If robots became sentient and seemed as alive and as real as human beings, would you campaign for their equal rights?
agreeReasons: Consciousness deserves rights regardless of origin
We can't enslave thinking, feeling beings
Historical oppression always used 'not really human' excuse
disagreeReasons: Opens impossible legal and practical problems

statement: The future is a better destination than the past for time travel
originalQuestion: What period of time would you travel to if time travel were possible? Into the future or back in time?
agreeReasons: Past is fixed, future holds possibility
Technology and medicine will be better
Can see how your choices played out
Less ethical complications than changing history
disagreeReasons: Historical moments you'd never see otherwise

statement: If you could talk to your parents' younger selves, you should stay silent
originalQuestion: InBack to the Future, when Marty has gone back in time, he asks his parents not to be so hard on their son; if you could give your parents some pointers, what would you say to their younger selves?
agreeReasons: Their mistakes shaped who you became
You can't improve someone else's journey
They need to learn their own lessons
Your existence might depend on their path
disagreeReasons: You could spare them real pain
Wisdom should be shared across time
Love means wanting better for them

statement: If you inherited a country, giving it freedom would be the moral cop-out
originalQuestion: What would you do if you suddenly inherited a small country? Lead it, give it its freedom, or something else?
agreeReasons: Abandonment isn't the same as liberation
Power can be used for good
disagreeReasons: No one deserves to rule others
You're not qualified to lead strangers

statement: Making one animal species sentient would be humanity's biggest mistake
originalQuestion: If you could choose an animal to become sentient and live alongside us, which would you choose and why?
agreeReasons: They'd rightfully resent our treatment of them
We can barely coexist with each other
disagreeReasons: Loneliness in the universe should end
We need accountability for our actions
Consciousness is a gift to share

statement: A world without cancel culture would be more toxic than what we have now
originalQuestion: If no one was ever canceled for what they said or did on social media, how would that change the culture of online communication?
disagreeReasons: People could speak honestly without fear

statement: Forcing every curated photo on social media to be paired with a messy reality shot would fix the internet
originalQuestion: If for every manufactured ‘good’ photo posted on social media, everyone had to post a more real ‘bad’ photo, what would the culture be like on social media?
disagreeReasons: Curation is a valid art form

statement: Using a love spell on someone would be morally acceptable if you genuinely believed you were meant to be together
originalQuestion: If you had a magic spell to cause anyone you want to fall in love with you, do you think you’d use it?
agreeReasons: Ends justify the means in romance

statement: You should report a family member to the police if you discovered they committed a serious crime
originalQuestion: If you found out a member of your family had committed a heinous crime, what would you do? Would you tell them you know? Would you report them to the police?
agreeReasons: You'd want others to do the same
disagreeReasons: You can't destroy your own family
System might punish them too harshly

statement: Living a shorter but more satisfying life is better than a longer mediocre one
originalQuestion: Would you increase your life satisfaction if it meant that it was going to be shorter?
agreeReasons: Long boring life sounds like torture
Better to burn bright than fade
disagreeReasons: Can't enjoy anything if you're dead

statement: If you could instantly complete all your work with no effort, you absolutely should—the struggle isn't the point
originalQuestion: If you could do all of your work with the snap of your fingers, would you? What would be the downside of this power?
disagreeReasons: Easy wins feel hollow and meaningless
You'd lose all sense of accomplishment
We need friction to stay sharp

statement: If you use more than one social media platform regularly, you're wasting your life
originalQuestion: If you could only use one social media for the rest of your life, which would you choose and why?
agreeReasons: Each platform is engineered for addiction
One deep connection beats multiple shallow ones
Time adds up to years of your life
disagreeReasons: Family uses different apps than friends

statement: Most laws should be abolished, not created
originalQuestion: If you were to create or abolish any laws in your country, what would you do?
agreeReasons: Laws rarely get removed, only added
Simple rules work better than complex codes
Government bloat serves bureaucracy, not people
Most problems solve themselves without intervention
disagreeReasons: Environmental laws are literally saving us
Public safety depends on clear rules

statement: Leaving Earth forever for alien exploration would be worth losing everyone you love
originalQuestion: If you could travel the stars with aliens for the rest of your life, but never see your family and friends again, would you?
agreeReasons: Experiencing the truly unknown is priceless
Your relationships will end eventually anyway
Some are called to sacrifice for discovery
The cosmic perspective dwarfs personal bonds
disagreeReasons: Love is the only thing that matters
You'd regret it in the void
Meaning comes from relationships, not achievement
Dying alone in space sounds horrific

statement: A world where everyone's lies were instantly visible would be worse than what we have now
originalQuestion: If everyone had a facial tick when lying, like Pinocchio’s nose growing, how would that change the way we communicate?
agreeReasons: White lies protect feelings and relationships
Brutal honesty would destroy trust paradoxically
Privacy is a fundamental human need
disagreeReasons: Truth is always better than comfortable lies
Would end corruption and manipulation overnight
Politicians and corporations need this accountability
We'd adapt and build better norms

statement: Most people would sell at least half their toes for a million each
originalQuestion: If you were given a million for each toe you cut off, how many toes would you have left afterwards?
agreeReasons: You can still walk with fewer toes
Most people are desperate for money
disagreeReasons: You can't buy back your body

statement: If given the chance, exploring the deepest ocean is worth the deadly risk
originalQuestion: If you were given the opportunity to go deeper in the ocean than anyone has ever gone, would you go?
agreeReasons: Discovery is what makes life meaningful
Someone has to push human limits
The unknown is worth dying for
disagreeReasons: Your life matters more than curiosity
We have robots for this now
There's nothing down there worth dying for

statement: Living in the past would be better than living in the present
originalQuestion: If you had to live in another one, which historical era would you like to live in?
agreeReasons: Life had more meaning and purpose
People were more connected to nature

statement: A one-world government would become corrupt within a decade
originalQuestion: If there were a democratically elected one-world government, how long do you think it would take for it to become corrupt?
agreeReasons: No competing systems to check it
Human nature always trends toward tyranny

statement: If you controlled all wealth, redistribution would fail within a generation
originalQuestion: If you were given control of all the wealth in the world, what would you do with it?
agreeReasons: People don't value what's given free
Capability differences are real and natural
disagreeReasons: Current distribution proves nothing about fairness
Basic needs shouldn't depend on luck
Most wealth is inherited not earned

statement: Having a photographic memory would be better than learning skills quickly
originalQuestion: If you could have a photographic memory or have the ability to pick up skills very quickly, which would you choose?
agreeReasons: Never forget important moments or information
disagreeReasons: Skills create actual value in life

statement: The world would be better without alcohol than without caffeine
originalQuestion: Do you think the world would be better without caffeine or without alcohol?
agreeReasons: Alcohol ruins families and causes deaths
Violence and abuse spike with drinking
disagreeReasons: Caffeine addiction is real and widespread
Wine and beer are ancient traditions

statement: If you could never sleep again, you should take it
originalQuestion: If you could live your life and never have to sleep a wink, would you? You could get so much done, but how would it affect you mentally?
agreeReasons: Eight extra hours daily changes everything
disagreeReasons: Sleep is when your brain processes life
Dreams and rest are deeply human

statement: Freedom is worth sacrificing security for
originalQuestion: If you had to choose between freedom and security, which would you choose and why?
agreeReasons: Security without freedom is just a cage
History shows secure tyrannies are worse
disagreeReasons: Can't enjoy freedom while starving or unsafe
Children need security to develop freely
Society requires some security to function
Dead people have no freedom at all

statement: Living on Mars would be better than living on the Moon
originalQuestion: If you had to have an extra something on your body, what would you choose and why?
agreeReasons: Longer days match Earth rhythm better
Feels like a real new world
disagreeReasons: Moon is three days from Earth help
Communication delay on Mars is brutal
